content.text:
# Draft:King Keiigh

Kamogelo Ramalepe, popularly known by his stage name King Keiigh is a South African Hip-hop and Amapiano artist. He is known for his tv appearances on Mtv Base , Channel O , Trace Africa and his time as a radio dj and co-host at [https://www.tshwanefm.com/ Tshwane FM].

King Keiigh's first solo amapiano single Phuma Sathane gained 1 million streams across all digital platforms within 2 months of being released after going viral through the Phuma Sathane Challenge on Tik Tok.
Education
He first attended Masekwameng Primary School before moving to Pretoria where he attended Burgher Right Primary and Fusion Secondary School, He is currently completing his higher education at the University Of Limpopo.
Early Life
King Keiigh was born in Polokwane, Limpopo and grew up in a Christian family. He got inspired to do music by his late grandfather who used to play guitar and sing to them when they were young.
Career
He started his music journey by joining the school choir in Grade R. He then left the choir and started writing Lekompo songs with his cousin when he was in the third grade. That was until he heard Eminem's music and got inspired to become a rapper in 2010.
He rose to fame in early 2021 after his the song Money Talk from his debut EP started playing daily on the South African Music Channel , Channel O, which gave him massive popularity and saw his facebook page rise to more than half a million followers in that same year. In 2023 he released a single titled Phuma Sathane which was his first song to reach 1 million streams , reaching that milestone in a matter of 2 months. He has since worked with Kalawa Jazmee producer Wizibeatz , and 2x platinum producer Masterblaq.
